intro: Alstonia deplanchei var. ndokoaensis, commonly known as the Ndokoa alstonia, is a deciduous tree native to the tropical rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and elongated, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant white flowers followed by orange-red berries containing seeds. It is often found in lowland and montane forest habitats, thriving in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
